location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paper.Dimensions: 720 x 570mm, on a sheet 875 x 660mm.

mods.abstract: A map showing areas of Arabia, Persia, Russian Turkestan, and Baluchistan [modern-day Oman, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Bahrain, Kuwait, Iran, Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, and Pakistan].The map shows topographical and hydrological features, as well as telegraph and railway lines, and the Zones defined by the Anglo-Russian Convention of 31 August 1907. It also contains a statement describing areas of "uncertain sovereignty".It bears the printing statement 'Topographical Section. General Staff, No. 2385.'
